title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 235/86 of 31 January 1986 introducing Community surveillance of imports of video tape recorders originating in South Korea
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 235/86
of 31 January 1986
introducing Community surveillance of imports of video tape recorders originating in South Korea
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Imports into the Community of video tape recorders falling within subheading 92.11 B of the Common Customs Tariff and corresponding to NIMEXE code 92.11-91 and 99, originating in South Korea are hereby made subject to retrospective Community surveillance in accordance with the procedures set out in Articles 10 and 14 of Regulation (EEC) No 288/82 and this Regulation.

Annex II of Regulation (EEC) No 288/82 is modified by the insertion of the Common Customs Tariff heading and the NIMEXE code of the products referred to in Article 1 followed by the sign (+) in the 'EUR' column.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply with effect from 1 January 1986.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 31 January 1986.
For the Commission
Willy DE CLERCQ
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 35, 9. 2. 1982, p. 1.
(2) OJ No L 330, 18. 12. 1984, p. 8.
